channel.title: Posts on Mark's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Mark's Blog

item.title: Alberta Median Income Using Cansim and Tidyverse
item.description: In the previous post I looked reproducing the chart from the CBC article “Albertans still make the most money, but other provinces are catching up” using base R functionality. In this post I’ll try and do the same using the cansim package to retrieve StatCan data, and the Tidyverse tools to wrangle the data and create the chart. library(cansim) library(tidyverse) Although the cansim package has the ability to cache data in a SQLLite database, for now I’ll continue to manually manage this.

item.title: Alberta Median Income Using R
item.description: I ran across this article on the CBC website “Albertans still make the most money, but other provinces are catching up” and it has the following chart: The size of the difference between Alberta and the other Canadian provinces surprises me, but it cites the relevant StatsCan Table so I should be able to reproduce this. Sounds like a nice challenge for my nascent R skills. I’m a complete beginner with R, so none of the following should be interpreted as best practice.
